page.title: 05LIFE & SOCIAL LIFE, CARNELL
page.content: The WRI meets monthly for educational talks, cookery demonstrations, handicraft demonstrations etc. The Young Farmers Club meets weekly. Carnell Curling Club for tenants, friends and neighbours no longer curl on estate pond but on an artificial ice rink at Ayr. There is a private squash court and tennis court on the estate. There are sewing 'bees' in private houses and bridge clubs. Some people attend agricultural classes at the college eight miles away. There are cattle club meetings in Ayr. Picnics for local children are held at Mansion House. This event has been held for eighty years. Some young boys and girls enjoy pony club events, one girl competes at national level. Men go green and indoor bowling. Some people follow foxhounds by car or on foot.
